description: Captain Leclere died of brain-fever off Civita Vecchia.
timestamp_hint: Three days before the current scene

description: Captain Leclere was buried at sea off El Giglio island.
timestamp_hint: Three days before the current scene

description: Caderousse visits the Dantès home and talks with Edmond and his father.

description: Fernand tries to convince Mercédès to marry him, but she rejects him, stating her love for Dantès

description: Fernand proposes to Mercédès, who rejects him

description: Edmond returns to Mercédès

description: Fernand confronts Edmond upon his return

description: Caderousse, drunk and envious, makes comments about Edmond and Mercédès, trying to provoke Fernand.

description: Danglars, envious and plotting, observes the interactions and makes sinister comments.

name: Wedding Plans
description: Edmond and Mercédès discuss their wedding plans, inviting the group to the ceremony.

description: Fernand becomes extremely distressed, pale, and physically uncomfortable.

description: Edmond Dantès is arrested by a magistrate and soldiers

name: Caderousse's suspicions
description: Caderousse accuses Danglars and suspects Fernand

description: M. Morrel and Danglars have a conversation about Dantès' arrest and Danglars' suspicions.
location: The location where the conversation is taking place

description: Mercédès bursts into hysterical sobbing after Dantès' arrest.
location: The location where the conversation is taking place

location: The location where the conversation is taking place

name: Political Discussion
description: Villefort and the noblemen discuss the political situation, Napoleon's exile, and the need for vigilance against Bonapartist sympathies.

description: Villefort defends his political stance and pleads for the past to be forgotten.

description: Villefort offers to arrange a trial for the young women to attend, discussing the dramatic nature of such events.

location: At a gathering, possibly at the marquis and marquise's home.

location: At a gathering, possibly at the marquis and marquise's home.

description: Villefort traveled to M. de Saint-Méran’s and then to Paris

description: Edmond knocks against the wall to stop the noise

description: Dantès is horrified by the revelation and forms a fearful resolution.

description: Abbé Faria invites Dantès to share his supper, which includes finer bread and wine.

name: Dantès' Resolution
description: Dantès forms a resolution to seek vengeance and escape prison

name: Faria's Invitation

name: Education Plan

description: The president threatens the general and orders the doors to be closed, implying a deadly consequence.

name: Franz's Reading
description: Franz reads the manuscript aloud, interrupting with emotional comments about his father.

name: Forced Oath
description: The general is forced to swear an oath to keep the assembly's secrets or face death.
timestamp_hint: 5th of February, 1815, between nine and ten o'clock in the evening

name: Duel
description: The general and the president engage in a duel after the general insults the conspirators.

name: Disposal of the Body
description: The witnesses dispose of the general's body in the river after the duel.
timestamp_hint: After the duel on the 5th of February, 1815

name: Reading of the Narrative
description: Franz reads aloud the details of his father's death, affecting the listeners.

name: Revelation of Noirtier's Involvement
description: Noirtier reveals himself as the killer of Franz's father through a series of yes/no responses using a dictionary.

name: Franz's Distress
description: Franz falls powerless on a chair after learning the truth about his father's killer.

name: Villefort's Escape
description: Villefort opens the door and escapes after Franz learns the truth.

name: M. Cavalcanti the Elder's Return
description: M. Cavalcanti the Elder returns to his service at the gaming-table of the baths of Lucca.

name: Andrea's Rise in Society
description: Andrea Cavalcanti gains a position in Parisian society, called a count, and said to possess 50,000 livres per annum.

name: Monte Cristo's Visit
description: Monte Cristo visits Madame Danglars and produces a calming effect with his presence.

name: Monte Cristo's Arrival
description: Monte Cristo enters the boudoir and observes the scene.

name: Andrea's Admiration
description: Andrea Cavalcanti shows admiration for Mademoiselle Danglars with sighs and glances.

name: Mademoiselle Danglars' Escape
description: Mademoiselle Danglars escapes to her study to play the piano with Mademoiselle d’Armilly.

name: Conversation Between Monte Cristo and Madame Danglars
description: Monte Cristo and Madame Danglars discuss financial matters and the Villeforts' misfortunes.

name: Andrea's Singing
description: Andrea Cavalcanti sings a Corsican song accompanied by the piano in the study.

name: Marriage Alliance Discussion
description: Danglars and Monte Cristo discuss the potential marriage alliance between Mademoiselle Danglars and M. Cavalcanti.

name: Danglars' Agitation
description: Danglars receives news from Greece and becomes visibly agitated.

name: Albert's Departure
description: Albert and Monte Cristo leave Danglars' house, with Albert laughing loudly and asking Monte Cristo how he played his part.

name: Albert's Visit to Monte Cristo
description: Albert de Morcerf visits Monte Cristo to discuss his romantic troubles and seek advice.

name: Discussion of Andrea Cavalcanti
description: Albert and Monte Cristo discuss Andrea Cavalcanti's romantic pursuits and his rivalry with Albert.

name: Serving Tea and Smoking
description: Monte Cristo's servants, Baptistin and Ali, efficiently serve tea and smoking pipes to Albert and Monte Cristo.

name: Haydée's Music
description: Haydée plays the guzla, providing musical entertainment in the background.

name: Albert's request to meet Haydée
description: Albert asks the Count to present him to Haydée, and the Count agrees under certain conditions

name: Albert's fascination with Haydée
description: Albert is struck by Haydée's beauty and is unable to move from the door

name: Haydée's welcome of the Count
description: Haydée welcomes the Count with a smile, showing her obedience and love for him

name: Haydée's inquiry about Albert
description: Haydée asks the Count about Albert's identity and how she should converse with him

name: Greeting and Introduction
description: Monte Cristo introduces Albert to Haydée, who greets him warmly in Italian.

name: Serving Refreshments
description: Ali brings coffee and pipes, and two women bring ices and sherbet.

name: Conversation About Haydée's Past
description: Albert asks Haydée about her past and her memories of Greece.

name: Reminder About the Traitor
description: Monte Cristo reminds Haydée not to mention the name of the traitor or the treason.

name: Flight to the Kiosk
description: Ali Tepelini and his family flee to a kiosk in the middle of a lake to escape his enemies.

name: Preparation for Possible Escape or Last Stand
description: Ali Tepelini prepares for his fate, possibly awaiting a firman that will decide his future.

name: Haydée's Narrative
description: Haydée recounts the events of her family's flight and the kiosk to Monte Cristo and Albert.

name: Ali Tepelini's Preparation for Battle
description: Ali Tepelini prepares for battle, observing approaching boats and giving orders to his family and guards.

name: Vasiliki and Haydée's Move to the Cavern
description: Vasiliki and Haydée move to the cavern, where they are joined by Selim, awaiting the outcome of the emperor's decision.

name: Haydée's Narrative
description: Haydée recounts the events of her past to Albert and Monte Cristo, initially silent and then resuming her narrative.

name: Approach of the Boats
description: Boats approach the kiosk, possibly bringing news of the emperor's decision.

name: Arrival of the messenger
description: Brings the answer of the emperor, granting a full pardon to the Vizier Ali

name: Selim examines the ring
description: Recognizes it as his master's ring and extinguishes the match

name: Selim's death
description: Stabbed by soldiers after extinguishing the match

name: The pasha demands Haydée's head
description: Haydée overhears the demand from the other side of a door

name: Haydée overhears the pasha's execution
description: Pasha kills two men and the room is filled with fire and smoke

name: Attack on Ali Tepelini
description: Ali Tepelini was attacked by Palikares and killed
timestamp_hint: During the recital of Haydée's story

name: Haydée's Recital
description: Haydée recounted the story of her father's death and her enslavement

name: Display of Ali Tepelini's Head
description: Haydée and her mother saw Ali Tepelini's head displayed at the imperial gates

name: Haydée's Enslavement
description: Haydée was sold to a rich Armenian and later to Sultan Mahmoud

name: Valentine's Marriage Dissolution
description: Valentine's marriage is broken off, and Madame de Villefort visits M. Noirtier to request Valentine's fortune
timestamp_hint: During the time occupied by the interview between Valentine and Morrel

name: M. Noirtier's New Will
description: M. Noirtier makes a new will leaving his fortune to Valentine
timestamp_hint: The next day after Madame de Villefort's visit

name: Monte Cristo's Visit to Morcerf
description: Monte Cristo pays a visit to the Count of Morcerf
timestamp_hint: While the proceedings relative to the dissolution of the marriage-contract were being carried on

name: Morcerf's Proposal to Danglars
description: Count of Morcerf visits Danglars to ask for the hand of Mademoiselle Eugénie Danglars for his son
timestamp_hint: After Monte Cristo's visit to Morcerf

name: Danglars' Refusal
description: Danglars refuses to immediately give an answer to Morcerf's request for his daughter's hand

name: Confrontation Over Marriage Alliance
description: Albert de Morcerf confronts Baron Danglars about the broken marriage alliance between their families.

name: Danglars' Evasive Response
description: Danglars refuses to give a clear reason for breaking off the marriage alliance, hinting at calumnies.

name: Morcerf's Departure
description: Albert de Morcerf leaves Danglars' house in anger after receiving no satisfactory explanation.

name: Danglars' Conference
description: Danglars has a long conference with several friends after Morcerf's departure.

name: Danglars Reads Newspaper
description: Danglars reads a newspaper with a malicious smile, focusing on a paragraph about Yanina.

name: Danglars Reads Newspaper Article
description: Danglars reads a newspaper article about Morcerf and smiles maliciously.

name: Morcerf Seeks Monte Cristo's Help
description: Morcerf visits Monte Cristo's house to seek his help as a second in a duel.

name: Monte Cristo Shoots Playing Cards
description: Monte Cristo shoots playing cards with precision, turning them into different values.

name: Morcerf and Monte Cristo Discuss Duel
description: Morcerf and Monte Cristo discuss the duel and Monte Cristo agrees to be Morcerf's second.

name: Discussion about the duel
description: Monte Cristo advises Albert about the duel and suggests seeking information from Haydée

name: Publication of the article
description: Beauchamp published an article that Albert finds offensive

name: Albert's Visit to Beauchamp
description: Albert visits Beauchamp to demand a retraction of a statement about his father
timestamp_hint: After Albert's conversation with Monte Cristo

name: Albert's Conversation with Monte Cristo
description: Albert seeks advice from Monte Cristo on how to handle the situation with Beauchamp

name: Beauchamp Reads the Article
description: Beauchamp reads the article in question and discusses the retraction with Albert

name: Heated Argument
description: Albert demands Beauchamp retract an article about his father, Fernand Mondego, leading to a heated argument.

name: Duel Challenge
description: Albert challenges Beauchamp to a duel if he does not retract the article.

name: Agreement to Duel
description: Beauchamp agrees to a duel but requests three weeks to prepare.

name: Albert's Anger Outburst
description: Albert vents his anger on a pile of newspapers before leaving.

name: Confrontation between Albert and Beauchamp
description: Beauchamp confronts Albert, advising him to refrain from fighting for the next 24 days

name: Albert's Anger Outburst
description: Albert vents his anger on newspapers and his carriage
location: Outside the office, crossing the barrier

name: Morrel's Quick Walk
description: Morrel walks quickly from the Rue Meslay to Noirtier's house
location: From Rue Meslay to Faubourg Saint-Honoré

name: Meeting in Noirtier's Study
description: Noirtier, Morrel, and Valentine meet to discuss Noirtier's plan to leave the house and Valentine's future

name: Valentine's Declaration
description: Valentine declares her intention to leave with Noirtier and marry Morrel when she comes of age

name: Barrois' collapse
description: Barrois suddenly collapses with convulsions, stiffening limbs, and difficulty breathing

name: Valentine and Morrel's adieux
description: Valentine and Morrel exchange adieux in the presence of Noirtier

name: Villefort's arrival
description: Villefort arrives and is shocked by Barrois' condition, calls for the doctor

name: Madame de Villefort's arrival
description: Madame de Villefort arrives and appears indifferent to the crisis

name: Barrois' Illness
description: Barrois suffers from a fit of apoplexy and is attended to by the doctor.

name: Villefort's Reaction
description: Villefort is stupefied with astonishment and calls for the doctor.

name: Madame de Villefort's Arrival
description: Madame de Villefort arrives with smelling-salts and seems indifferent.

name: Morrel's Departure
description: Morrel emerges from hiding and leaves the house by a back staircase.
location: The Room and The Back Staircase

name: Doctor's Examination
description: The doctor examines Barrois and prescribes treatment.

name: Lemonade Investigation
description: The doctor investigates the lemonade and finds it has a bitter taste.

name: Examination of the Lemonade
description: d’Avrigny examines the lemonade and determines it is poisoned.

name: Barrois' Convulsions
description: Barrois suffers severe convulsions and pleads for help.

name: Interrogation of Noirtier
description: d’Avrigny questions Noirtier about the lemonade, revealing Valentine brought it to him.

name: Barrois' Death
description: Barrois dies from the poison despite d’Avrigny's efforts.

name: Accusation of Poisoning
description: d’Avrigny accuses Villefort of poisoning, citing the sudden deaths in the household.

name: Test for Poison
description: d’Avrigny tests the lemonade with syrup of violets to confirm the presence of poison.

name: Poison Detection
description: M. d’Avrigny conducts a chemical test to detect poison in the lemonade, which turns the syrup of violets green.

name: Villefort's Reaction
description: Villefort is overcome with emotion and sinks into a chair upon learning of the poisoning.

name: Accusation
description: M. d’Avrigny accuses Villefort of being involved in the crimes and urges him to act as a magistrate.

name: Barrois' Poisoning
description: Barrois is revealed to have been poisoned by the lemonade, which was intended for M. Noirtier.

name: Confrontation Between Villefort and M. d’Avrigny
description: M. d’Avrigny accuses Valentine of poisoning and demands that Villefort take action. Villefort pleads for mercy and ultimately agrees to keep the secret.

name: Death of Barrois
description: Barrois, an old servant, dies. M. d’Avrigny attributes his death to apoplexy but hints at foul play.

name: Servants' Decision to Leave
description: The servants, fearing for their lives, decide to leave Villefort's household.

name: Doctor's Visit
description: The doctor attended to Villefort's father, who died of apoplexy, and instructed Villefort to throw away a cup of syrup of violets.

name: Servants' Departure
description: The servants decided to leave Villefort's household, believing that death is in the house.

name: Count of Morcerf's Departure
description: The Count of Morcerf left Danglars' house feeling shame and anger due to the rejection of a proposed alliance.

name: Andrea Cavalcanti's Visit
description: Andrea Cavalcanti visited Danglars' house to discuss marriage and financial arrangements with Danglars.

name: Financial Negotiations
description: Andrea Cavalcanti and Danglars discussed the financial aspects of their potential marriage, including dowries and investments.

name: Andrea Cavalcanti receives Caderousse's letter
description: Caderousse sends a letter to Andrea Cavalcanti, inviting him to meet the next morning

name: Andrea Cavalcanti meets with Caderousse
description: Andrea Cavalcanti meets with Caderousse for breakfast

name: Financial Discussion
description: Andrea and Caderousse discuss financial plans, including Caderousse's desire for a larger sum of money and Andrea's inheritance from Monte Cristo.

name: Negotiation for Allowance

name: Discussion of Monte Cristo's House
description: Andrea describes the layout and luxury of Monte Cristo's house to Caderousse, who expresses envy and interest.

name: Andrea Gives Money to Caderousse

name: Caderousse's Plan to Rob Monte Cristo
description: Caderousse thinks about robbing Monte Cristo's house, especially when he is away at Auteuil.

name: Conversation Between Andrea and Caderousse
description: Andrea and Caderousse discuss wealth, property, and Andrea's future plans. Andrea gives Caderousse a diamond ring.
timestamp_hint: The day before the count's journey to Auteuil

name: Count's Journey to Auteuil
description: The Count of Monte Cristo travels to Auteuil with Ali and several attendants, taking horses with him.
timestamp_hint: The day following the conversation between Andrea and Caderousse

name: Preparations for Departure
description: The count praises Bertuccio's zeal and orders preparations for a speedy departure, including eight fresh horses for a journey from Paris to Tréport.
timestamp_hint: During the count's stay in Auteuil

description: The count receives a letter warning of an impending break-in at his house.
timestamp_hint: Before the count's departure to Paris

name: Preparing for Ambush
description: The count arms himself and waits in ambush to confront the intruder.
timestamp_hint: Around half-past nine in the evening

description: The count orders Baptistin to gather all servants in Paris and leave only the porter.
timestamp_hint: Before the count's departure to Paris

description: Monte Cristo confronts Caderousse, who is attempting to rob the dressing-room.

name: Observation from the Street
description: A man on the fence observes the count's dressing-room, engrossed with what is happening inside.

name: Ali's Concealment
description: Ali is instructed by Monte Cristo to remain hidden and only intervene if called.

timestamp_hint: Nighttime, before 1 AM (based on the Invalides clock striking one)

name: Forced Confession
description: Caderousse is forced to write a confession revealing Benedetto's true identity and criminal past.

name: Expulsion and Escape
description: Caderousse is expelled through the window and escapes, while the abbé observes him from the window.
location: Count of Monte Cristo's House and Champs-Élysées
timestamp_hint: Nighttime, around 1 AM (based on the Invalides clock striking one)

name: Attack on Caderousse
description: Benedetto waylaid and attacked Caderousse, striking him three times and leaving him for dead
location: The wall and street outside the house
timestamp_hint: Shortly after the clock of the Invalides struck one

name: Caderousse's rescue and medical aid
description: Monte Cristo and Ali found Caderousse and provided medical aid, recording his deposition before he died
location: A room in Monte Cristo's house

name: Recording of Caderousse's deposition
description: Monte Cristo wrote down Caderousse's accusation against Benedetto and had him sign it
location: A room in Monte Cristo's house
timestamp_hint: While Caderousse was still alive but near death

name: Confrontation between Monte Cristo and Caderousse
description: Monte Cristo confronts Caderousse about his past crimes and the concept of divine justice, while Caderousse denies the existence of God and expresses his despair.

name: Revelation of Monte Cristo's identity
description: Monte Cristo reveals his true identity to Caderousse, shocking him.

name: Caderousse's Death
description: Caderousse dies after recognizing the Count and repenting for his past sins.
timestamp_hint: Before the arrival of the surgeon and the procureur

name: Attempted Robbery and Murder
description: Caderousse attempts to rob the Count and is killed by Benedetto.
timestamp_hint: Before the Count's return from Auteuil

name: Investigation
description: The police search for Benedetto, and the Count provides an alibi.

name: Marriage Preparations
description: Preparations for the marriage of Mademoiselle Danglars to Andrea Cavalcanti.
timestamp_hint: After the attempted robbery and murder

name: Duel Preparation
description: Albert prepares for a duel with Beauchamp over an insult.

description: Beauchamp presents evidence that Albert's father, Fernand de Morcerf, betrayed his commander, Ali Tepelini, for money.

name: Albert's Distress
description: Albert is deeply affected by the revelation, becoming pale and distressed, and eventually tearing up the evidence.

name: Beauchamp's Offer to Destroy Evidence
description: Beauchamp offers to destroy the evidence to protect Albert's family honor, and Albert accepts, tearing up the papers.

name: Broken Engagement
description: Albert's engagement with Mademoiselle Danglars is broken off.
timestamp_hint: Before the visit to Monte Cristo

name: Discussion of the Scandal
description: Albert and Beauchamp discuss the scandal involving Albert's father and the broken engagement.
timestamp_hint: Before the visit to Monte Cristo

name: Visit to Monte Cristo
description: Albert and Beauchamp visit Monte Cristo to discuss the scandal and the broken engagement.

name: Discussion of M. Cavalcanti
description: Monte Cristo discusses M. Cavalcanti's possible engagement to Mademoiselle Danglars.
timestamp_hint: During the visit to Monte Cristo

name: Monte Cristo's Annoyance
description: Monte Cristo expresses his annoyance with the brief preparing against him.
timestamp_hint: During the visit to Monte Cristo

name: Proposal of a Trip
description: Monte Cristo proposes a trip to Normandy to Albert and Beauchamp.

name: Discussion of Legal Proceedings
description: Monte Cristo discusses his annoyance with the legal proceedings against him.

name: Preparation for the Journey
description: Monte Cristo instructs Bertuccio to prepare for the journey to Normandy.

name: Departure to Normandy
description: Albert and Monte Cristo depart for Normandy in a traveling britzka.

description: Monte Cristo and Albert travel rapidly to Normandy with Monte Cristo's own horses and servants.
location: From Monte Cristo's residence to Normandy and then to the park.

name: Arrival at the Park
description: Monte Cristo and Albert arrive at a beautiful park by the sea, where luxury and ease abound.

name: Florentin's Arrival
description: Albert's valet de chambre arrives with a letter and newspaper, possibly with important news.

name: Reception of the Letter
description: Albert receives a letter and newspaper from Florentin revealing his father's past.
timestamp_hint: Towards the evening of the third day

name: Albert's Reaction
description: Albert is shocked and physically transformed by the revelation, then rushes to return to Paris.
timestamp_hint: Towards the evening of the third day

name: Albert's Departure
description: Albert leaves Monte Cristo's estate to return to Paris, using a horse provided by Monte Cristo.
timestamp_hint: Towards the evening of the third day

name: Albert's Arrival in Paris
description: Albert arrives at Beauchamp's house to seek information about the scandal.
timestamp_hint: At eight o'clock in the morning

name: Beauchamp's Explanation
description: Beauchamp explains the details of the scandal to Albert.
timestamp_hint: At eight o'clock in the morning

name: Beauchamp’s Visit to the Editor
description: Beauchamp visited the editor of the ministerial paper to discuss the article on Morcerf.

description: Members of the House of Peers discussed the article on Morcerf and decided on an investigation.
participants: Members of the House of Peers

name: Morcerf’s Reaction
description: Morcerf turned pale and was overwhelmed upon hearing the mention of Yanina and Colonel Fernand.

name: Decision on Investigation
description: The House of Peers decided to conduct an immediate investigation into the article on Morcerf.
participants: Members of the House of Peers

name: Committee Formation
description: A committee of twelve members was chosen to examine the proofs brought forward by Morcerf.

name: Committee Examination
description: The committee examines Morcerf's defence against accusations

description: Morcerf presents documents and the ring from Ali Pasha, claims to have been entrusted with Vasiliki and Haydée

name: Beauchamp's Narrative
description: Beauchamp narrates the events of the examination to Albert

name: Arrival of a Witness
description: A witness arrives and presents a letter to the president
timestamp_hint: During the examination, after Morcerf's defence

description: Haydée presents evidence against M. de Morcerf, revealing her identity and the sale of her and her mother

name: Reading of the Anonymous Letter
description: The president reads an anonymous letter announcing Haydée's arrival as a witness

description: Fernand Mondego (M. de Morcerf) sells Haydée and her mother to El-Kobbir

name: Death of Vasiliki
description: Vasiliki dies after being sold and transported to Constantinople

name: Presentation of the Document
description: Haydée presents a document in the House of Peers acknowledging the receipt of an emerald and the sale of Haydée
participants: President of the House of Peers

name: Accusation of M. de Morcerf
description: Haydée accuses M. de Morcerf of betraying her father, Ali Tepelini, and selling her and her mother into slavery
participants: President of the House of Peers

name: M. de Morcerf's Reaction
description: M. de Morcerf attempts to deny the accusations, hides his mutilated hand, and falls back on his seat overwhelmed by wretchedness and despair
participants: President of the House of Peers

name: Betrayal of Ali Tepelini
description: Fernand Mondego (M. de Morcerf) betrayed Ali Tepelini, surrendered the castle of Yanina, and sold Haydée and her mother into slavery

name: Count of Morcerf's Conviction
description: The Count of Morcerf was accused and convicted of felony, treason, and conduct unbecoming a member of the House
participants: Members of the committee of inquiry
location: House of the Committee of Inquiry

name: Count of Morcerf's Flight
description: The Count of Morcerf tore open his coat and fled the room like a madman
location: House of the Committee of Inquiry

name: Haydée's Departure
description: Haydée remained until the close of the meeting, drew her veil, bowed majestically, and left
location: House of the Committee of Inquiry

name: Beauchamp's Departure

location: House of the Committee of Inquiry

name: Albert's Determination
description: Albert expressed his determination to seek revenge and asked Beauchamp for assistance

name: Beauchamp's Revelation
description: Beauchamp revealed that Danglars had questioned the chief banker of Yanina about the Count of Morcerf

name: Confrontation in Danglars' study
description: Albert forces his way into Danglars' study and confronts him, accusing him of causing his father's dishonor

name: Danglars' revelation
description: Danglars reveals that Monte Cristo advised him to write to Yanina, implicating the Count in the affair

name: Confrontation with Danglars
description: Albert confronts Danglars about his accusations against Monte Cristo and his father

name: Decision to Confront Monte Cristo
description: Albert decides to seek Monte Cristo for an explanation and revenge

name: Visit to Mercédès
description: Albert visits his grieving mother, Mercédès, who is overwhelmed with grief
timestamp_hint: After deciding to confront Monte Cristo

name: Plan to Meet at the Opera
description: Albert plans to meet Monte Cristo at the Opera with Beauchamp and Château-Renaud

name: Albert Visits Mercédès
description: Albert visits his grieving mother and discusses revenge

name: Albert Prepares for the Opera
description: Albert dresses carefully and goes to the Opera with Beauchamp and Château-Renaud

name: Monte Cristo Arrives at the Opera
description: Monte Cristo arrives at the Opera with Morrel and avoids noticing Albert's threatening gaze

name: Albert Confronts Monte Cristo
description: Albert, pale and trembling, confronts Monte Cristo with Beauchamp and Château-Renaud

name: Altercation between Albert and Monte Cristo
description: Albert demands an explanation from Monte Cristo, Monte Cristo refuses and threatens Albert

name: Apology by Beauchamp
description: Beauchamp apologizes for Albert's behavior

name: Confrontation at the Opera
description: Monte Cristo remains calm and composed while Beauchamp apologizes for Albert's behavior and arranges the details of the duel.

name: Arrangement of the Duel
description: Beauchamp and Monte Cristo agree on the terms of the duel, including the choice of arms and the location.

name: Preparation for the Duel
description: Monte Cristo examines his pistols and prepares for the duel, while Morrel agrees to be his second witness.

name: Veiled Woman's Plea

name: Mercédès' Confrontation
description: Mercédès reveals herself to the Count of Monte Cristo and pleads for her son's life.

name: Monte Cristo's Revelation
description: Monte Cristo explains his past imprisonment and reasons for revenge against Fernand Mondego.

name: Letter Presentation
description: Monte Cristo shows Mercédès the letter that led to his arrest.

name: Edmond Dantès' Arrest
description: Edmond Dantès was arrested due to a letter written by Danglars.

name: Edmond Dantès' Imprisonment
description: Edmond Dantès was imprisoned in the Château d'If for fourteen years.

name: Monte Cristo's Revelation of Vengeance
description: Monte Cristo reveals his past suffering and his vow of vengeance against Fernand and his family
location: Château d’If (mentioned in the context of past events)

name: Mercédès' Plea for Her Son
description: Mercédès pleads with Monte Cristo to spare her son's life, recalling her past love and suffering

name: Monte Cristo's Relenting
description: Monte Cristo initially refuses to spare Fernand's son but ultimately relents due to Mercédès' plea

name: Monte Cristo's Sacrifice
description: Monte Cristo expresses his willingness to die to save Mercédès' son and reflects on the sacrifice he is making.

name: Mercédès' Departure
description: Mercédès leaves Monte Cristo's study after expressing her gratitude and admiration for his sacrifice.
timestamp_hint: Before the carriage leaves the Champs-Élysées

name: Monte Cristo's Reflection
description: Monte Cristo falls into a profound gloom and reflects on the ruin of his projects and the burden of his past.

name: Writing the Will
description: Monte Cristo writes a codicil to his will explaining his impending death and bequeathing his fortune.

name: Haydée's Awakening
description: Haydée awakens and discovers Monte Cristo's intentions, leading her to tear up his will.

name: Reflection on Vengeance
description: Monte Cristo reflects on his past actions and the vengeance he has sought against his enemies.

name: Haydée's Reaction to Monte Cristo's Will
description: Haydée tears up Monte Cristo's will and faints.

name: Monte Cristo's Shooting Demonstration
description: Monte Cristo demonstrates his exceptional marksmanship with pistols.

name: Preparation for the Duel
description: Monte Cristo, Maximilian, and Emmanuel prepare to leave for the duel.
timestamp_hint: Just before leaving for the duel

name: Preparation for the Duel
description: Monte Cristo, Maximilian, and Emmanuel prepare to leave for the duel

name: Arrival at the Duel Site
description: Monte Cristo and his friends arrive at the place of meeting for the duel

name: Albert's Arrival
description: Albert de Morcerf arrives late for the duel, pale and unwell

name: Albert's Speech
description: Albert thanks his friends for their presence and speaks to Monte Cristo

name: Public Apology

name: Reading the note
description: Villefort reads a note from Madame de Villefort explaining her actions.

name: Confrontation with the Count of Monte Cristo
description: Villefort confronts the Abbé Busoni, who reveals himself to be the Count of Monte Cristo and an enemy seeking revenge.

name: Reveal of Identity
description: Villefort reveals to Dantès that he is the Count of Monte Cristo

name: Discovery of Wife and Child's Death
description: Dantès discovers the bodies of Villefort's wife and child

name: Villefort's Insanity
description: Villefort becomes insane after seeing the bodies of his wife and child

name: Count of Monte Cristo's Arrival
description: The Count of Monte Cristo arrives at the Morrel family home to take Maximilian on a journey.

name: Maximilian's Departure
description: Maximilian says farewell to his family and leaves with the Count of Monte Cristo.

name: Carriage Stop at Villejuif
description: The carriage stops at the top of the hill Villejuif, offering a view of Paris below.

name: Monte Cristo's Farewell to Paris
description: Monte Cristo stands on the hill Villejuif, gazing at Paris and delivering a monologue about his mission and departure.

name: Journey to Châlons
description: Monte Cristo and Maximilian travel rapidly to Châlons, where they board a steamboat.

name: Arrival in Marseilles
description: Monte Cristo and Maximilian arrive in Marseilles, recalling memories of the port and Maximilian's father.

name: Monte Cristo's Comfort to Maximilian
description: Monte Cristo comforts Maximilian, encouraging him to listen to his heart and find happiness.

name: Maximilian's Reflection
description: Maximilian reflects on his father's memory and the spot where his father embraced him.

name: Albert de Morcerf's Departure
description: Albert de Morcerf waves his hat to someone on the ship, indicating his departure.

name: Monte Cristo's Visit to Mercédès
description: Monte Cristo visits Mercédès in her garden, offering her consolation.

name: Mercédès's Grief
description: Mercédès weeps bitterly in the garden, grieving over her son's departure.

name: Mercédès' Confession of Guilt
description: Mercédès expresses her deep remorse and self-blame for her past actions, including her treatment of her husband and her inability to save him.
location: The place where Mercédès once enjoyed bliss

name: Monte Cristo's Explanation of His Transformation
description: Monte Cristo explains his transformation and his belief that he is an instrument of divine justice, driven to fulfill a greater purpose.
location: The place where Mercédès once enjoyed bliss

name: Monte Cristo's Attempt to Comfort Mercédès
description: Monte Cristo tries to comfort Mercédès by taking her hand and kissing it, but she withdraws.
location: The place where Mercédès once enjoyed bliss

name: Monte Cristo's Reflection
description: Monte Cristo reflects on his past life and the changes he has undergone.

name: Boat Ride
description: Monte Cristo takes a boat ride, recalling his past voyage to the Château d’If.

name: Visit to the Château d’If
description: Monte Cristo visits the Château d’If and his former dungeon, reliving his past imprisonment.

name: Concierge's Story
description: The concierge tells Monte Cristo a story about a dangerous prisoner and a mad priest, which indirectly refers to Monte Cristo's past.

name: Monte Cristo's Reflection
description: Monte Cristo listens to the concierge's story and recalls his past imprisonment and emotions
timestamp_hint: During the present time of the narrative

name: Concierge's Story
description: The concierge tells the story of the young man (Monte Cristo) and the mad priest (Faria) at the Château d'If
timestamp_hint: During the present time of the narrative

name: Faria's Death
description: Faria, the mad priest, falls ill and dies in his dungeon
timestamp_hint: In the past, before Monte Cristo's attempted escape

name: Young Man's Escape Attempt
description: The young man (Monte Cristo) carries off Faria's corpse, hides in the sack, and is thrown into the sea
location: Dungeon and sea near Château d'If
timestamp_hint: In the past, after Faria's death

name: Monte Cristo's Vengeful Thoughts
description: Monte Cristo reflects on his past and his desire for vengeance against Villefort
timestamp_hint: During the present time of the narrative

name: Dantès' recognition of his former prison
description: Dantès recognizes his former prison and reflects on his past

name: Guide showing Dantès around the prison
description: The guide shows Dantès around the prison and finds a hidden manuscript
timestamp_hint: Approximate: After Dantès' recognition of his former prison

name: Dantès' departure from the prison
description: Dantès departs from the prison with a hidden manuscript
timestamp_hint: Approximate: After finding the hidden manuscript

name: Farewell at the Harbor
description: The Count of Monte Cristo says farewell to Morrel and leaves for Italy.

name: Travel to Rome
description: Baron Danglars travels from Florence to Rome, staying at the Hôtel d’Espagne.
location: Florence to Rome Road, Aquapendente, La Storta, Rome

name: Visit to Thomson & French
description: Baron Danglars visits Thomson & French to conduct business.

name: Conversation with Peppino
description: Peppino and the clerk discuss Danglars' business.
timestamp_hint: After Danglars enters the inner room

name: Confirmation of Danglars' Fortune
description: The clerk confirms that Danglars' fortune is five million.

name: Danglars' Departure
description: Danglars leaves Rome to travel to Venice and Vienna.

name: Kidnapping of Danglars
description: Danglars is kidnapped by Luigi Vampa's men while traveling.

name: Danglars' Awakening
description: Danglars wakes up in the carriage, expecting to be at a posting-house but finds himself in a mysterious location.

name: Carriage Stop and Change of Horses
description: The carriage stops, horses are changed, and Danglars is pushed back into the carriage without any explanation.

name: Danglars' Attempt to Communicate
description: Danglars tries to communicate with the postilion and the men surrounding him, but receives only menacing responses.

name: Arrival at the Appian Way
description: The carriage arrives at the Appian Way, and Danglars recognizes the location and its monuments.

name: Danglars' Realization of Being Captured
description: Danglars realizes he is being taken by bandits and is filled with fear and anxiety.

name: Descent into the Hidden Path
description: Danglars is led by Peppino into a hidden path in the Campagna, possibly a bandit hideout.
timestamp_hint: At the end of the journey

name: Capture of Danglars
description: Danglars is captured by Roman banditti and brought to the catacombs.

name: Imprisonment of Danglars
description: Danglars is locked in a cell by Peppino.

name: Danglars' Reflection
description: Danglars reflects on his situation and the possibility of being ransomed.

name: Danglars' Awakening
description: Danglars wakes up in the cell and checks his possessions.

name: Danglars Discovers His Belongings
description: Danglars checks his pockets and finds his money and letter of credit untouched, realizing the bandits intend to ransom him.
timestamp_hint: Early in the morning, around half past five.

name: Danglars Observes the Bandits
description: Danglars watches the bandits through the cracks in the door, noting their appearance and behavior, including one eating black bread, cheese, and onions.

name: Danglars Requests Food
description: Danglars asks the bandits for food, initially being ignored by one guard but later successfully negotiating with Peppino.
timestamp_hint: Afternoon, around four hours after the initial request.

name: Peppino Arranges for Food
description: Peppino agrees to provide Danglars with food, summoning a young bandit to bring a fowl in a silver dish.

name: Danglars' Negotiation for Food and Water
description: Danglars attempts to negotiate for food and water with Peppino and Luigi Vampa
timestamp_hint: The next day after the previous events

name: Danglars' Desperation and Delirium
description: Danglars becomes increasingly desperate and delirious as he starves, eventually eating the matting of his cell
timestamp_hint: Over the course of several days

name: Danglars' Desperation
description: Danglars, starving and delirious, pleads for food and forgiveness, offering money to Peppino and Vampa.
timestamp_hint: Fourth and fifth days of his starvation

name: The Count's Revelation
description: The Count of Monte Cristo reveals himself to Danglars, forgives him, and orders Vampa to feed and release him.

name: Danglars' Release
description: Vampa feeds Danglars and releases him as per the Count's orders.

name: The Yacht's Approach
description: The yacht carrying the traveller and the captain approaches Monte Cristo.

name: The Signal Shot
description: The traveller fires a signal shot towards Monte Cristo.

name: Arrival at the Island
description: The traveller and the captain arrive at the island, and the traveller steps into the sea.
timestamp_hint: Before the meeting with the count

name: Meeting with the Count
description: The traveller meets the count on the island, who greets him and offers him a place to change.
timestamp_hint: After the traveller steps into the sea

name: Discussion of Suicide
description: The traveller and the count discuss the traveller's desire to die and his suffering.
timestamp_hint: After the meeting with the count

name: Morrel's Resignation to Death
description: Morrel expresses his calm acceptance of death and his gratitude to the count for offering a peaceful end.
timestamp_hint: Fifth of October, around nine o'clock in the evening

name: Count's Offer of a Peaceful Death
description: The count offers Morrel a peaceful death in the grotto, comparing it to the ancient Romans' approach to death.
timestamp_hint: Fifth of October, around nine o'clock in the evening

name: Count's Doubts About Morrel's Happiness
description: The count expresses his doubts about whether Morrel is truly unhappy enough to merit the happiness he is offering.
timestamp_hint: Fifth of October, around nine o'clock in the evening

name: Morrel's Consumption of the Mysterious Substance
description: Morrel consumes a mysterious substance offered by Monte Cristo, leading to a delirium-like state.

name: Revelation of Valentine
description: Monte Cristo reveals Valentine to Morrel, who sees her as an angel of mercy.

name: Valentine's Joy and Gratitude
description: Valentine expresses her joy and gratitude to Monte Cristo for bringing her and Morrel together.

name: Reunion of Valentine and Morrel
description: Valentine and Morrel are reunited after Morrel recovers from a near-death state.

name: Monte Cristo's Revelation
description: Monte Cristo reveals his feelings for Haydée and asks Valentine to protect her.
timestamp_hint: Before Haydée and Monte Cristo leave

name: Haydée's Confession
description: Haydée confesses her love for Monte Cristo and agrees to stay with him.

name: Morrel's Recovery
description: Morrel recovers from his near-death state and is overjoyed to see Valentine.

name: Letter Delivery
description: Jacopo delivers a letter from Monte Cristo to Valentine and Morrel.

name: Monte Cristo's Departure
description: Monte Cristo departs on a yacht, seen by Valentine and Morrel on the horizon

name: Reading Monte Cristo's Letter
description: Morrel reads a letter from Monte Cristo detailing his generosity and the inheritance for Morrel and Valentine

name: Valentine's Emotional Reaction
description: Valentine becomes pale and tearful upon learning of her father's madness and brother's death
timestamp_hint: During the reading of the letter

name: Meeting Jacopo
description: Valentine and Morrel meet Jacopo, who delivers Monte Cristo's letter and points out his departure
timestamp_hint: After finding the grotto door opened

description: Outlines the conditions under which a refund can be obtained for defective electronic works within 90 days of receipt

description: Users agree to indemnify the Foundation and related parties from liability arising from distribution, alteration, or defects caused by the user

name: Project Gutenberg Mission
description: Describes the mission of Project Gutenberg to distribute free electronic works in various formats

name: Foundation Establishment
description: The Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation was created in 2001 to ensure the future of Project Gutenberg

name: Donation Information
description: Provides details on how to make donations to the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation

name: General Information
description: Provides background on the origin and distribution of Project Gutenberg eBooks
